items.description: Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water
items.message:
River and lake levels are high on the Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water due to recent rainfall.
Further rainfall is forecast this afternoon, 02/11/2022, which will cause river and lake levels to remain high.
Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water, with low lying land expected to be most affected, particularly around The Upper Derwent from Seathwaite to Derwent Water.
We will continue to monitor levels closely.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.
This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 03/11/2022, or as the situation changes.

This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold.  We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.  Further rainfall is forecast over the next 36 hours.  
We continue to monitor the situation.  
Please see the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast.

items.description: Upper Avon River Swift and Clay Coton Brook

items.message: River levels have risen at the Willington Cableway river gauge and the Shardlow gauge. Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible. Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including Willington, Barrow upon Trent, Swarkestone, Bargate Lane and the access roads to Willington Meadows, the Twyford Village access road, Church Lane at Barrow, and Ingleby Lane. Further rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours. We expect river levels to remain high, but steady until 04.11.22. We are closely monitoring the situation. Please avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. This message will be updated by 17:00, 02.11.22 or as the situation changes.

This flood alert has now been removed. Further showers overnight will result in fluctuating river levels. Further rainfall is currently forecast for later on Wednesday 02/11/22. We will review the latest forecast and re-issue this flood alert if it is required.

This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels are steady and below the flood risk threshold. Further showery rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours.  
We continue to monitor the situation.

items.description: Middle River Mersey catchment including areas near Bramhall, Stockport, Sale, Altrincham and Urmston

floodArea.county: Cheshire East, Manchester, Salford, Stockport, Tameside, Trafford, Warrington

items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain.
 Further rainfall is forecast this evening.

River levels are slowly dropping following last night’s peak, subsequently this flood alert has been removed. We do expect more patchy localised heavy rain over the next 24 hours which may impact river levels again. However, we currently do not anticipate any impact. We continue to monitor the forecast.

This Flood Alert has been removed.

items.description: South East Somerset Rivers, Upper Reaches

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Yeo, River Cam, River Wriggle, Barwick Stream, West Coker Stream

items.message: Water levels have risen at the Sherborne Lake river gauge as a result of the recent heavy rainfall. Consequently, there is a low risk of flooding to low-lying land and roads, today, Tuesday, 1/11/22. Locations most vulnerable to flooding are the Sparkford to Weston Bampfylde road and Deep Ford Lane, Chetnole. Further rainfall is forecast today and later tomorrow, so we expect river levels to remain high. Our incident response staff are closely monitoring the situation. Please avoid using low-lying footpaths and plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers which may be flooded; refer to local authority website for local road closures. This message will be updated by 11:00 on Wednesday, 2/11/22, or as the situation changes.
This alert has now been removed. Further rain is forecast today, Wednesday 02/11/22 and levels may fluctuate. We will monitor the forecast and reissue this alert if required.
